title: Definitions
context: [ยง481R-1] Definitions. As used in this chapter: &ldquo;Commissioner&rdquo; means the insurance commissioner. &ldquo;Consumer&rdquo; means a person in this State who purchases or otherwise possesses a vehicle protection product. &ldquo;Department&rdquo; means the department of commerce and consumer affairs. &ldquo;Reimbursement insurance policy&rdquo; means a policy of insurance issued to a warrantor to: (1) Provide reimbursement to the warrantor under the terms of the insured vehicle protection product issued or sold by the warrantor; and (2) Pay on behalf of the warrantor, in the event of the warrantor&rsquo;s nonperformance, all covered obligations incurred by the warrantor under the terms of the insured vehicle protection product issued or sold by the warrantor. &ldquo;Seller&rdquo; means a person engaged in the business of offering a vehicle protection product for sale to a consumer. &ldquo;Vehicle identification number&rdquo; means a serial number or identification mark of any vehicle established by the manufacturer for the purpose of identifying the vehicle. &ldquo;Vehicle protection product&rdquo; means a product or system, which includes a written warranty, that is: (1) Installed or applied to a vehicle; and (2) Designed to prevent loss or damage to a vehicle from a specific cause. &ldquo;Warrantor&rdquo; means a person named under the terms of a vehicle protection product warranty as the contractual obligor to the consumer. [L 2002, c 237, pt of ยง1]
